metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1230 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The getHiddenProperty function in bindings/core/v8/V8EventListenerList.h in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 41.0.2272.76, has a name conflict with the AudioContext class, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via JavaScript code that adds an AudioContext event listener and triggers "type confusion."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1230` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
chromium-browser-l10n - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
chromium-chromedriver - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
